instruction: Use RhinoCommon AppearanceSettings.RestoreDefaults to Commits the default settings as the current settings.
Use RhinoCommon AppearanceSettings.SetPaintColor to Sets the logical paint color association to a specific .Net library color.
code:
import Rhino.ApplicationSettings

result = Rhino.ApplicationSettings.AppearanceSettings.SetPaintColor(3, System.Drawing.Color.Black, True)
# Returns: System.Void

instruction: Use RhinoCommon AppearanceSettings.SetPaintColor to Sets the logical paint color association to a specific .Net library color, without forced UI update.
code:
import Rhino.ApplicationSettings

result = Rhino.ApplicationSettings.AppearanceSettings.SetPaintColor(3, System.Drawing.Color.Black)
# Returns: System.Void

instruction: Use RhinoCommon AppearanceSettings.SetWidgetColor to Sets the logical widget color association to a specific .Net library color.
code:
import Rhino.ApplicationSettings

result = Rhino.ApplicationSettings.AppearanceSettings.SetWidgetColor(System.Drawing.Color.Black, System.Drawing.Color.Black, True)
# Returns: System.Void

instruction: Use RhinoCommon AppearanceSettings.SetWidgetColor to Sets the logical widget color association to a specific .Net library color, without forced UI update.
code:
import Rhino.ApplicationSettings

result = Rhino.ApplicationSettings.AppearanceSettings.SetWidgetColor(System.Drawing.Color.Black, System.Drawing.Color.Black)
# Returns: System.Void

instruction: Use RhinoCommon AppearanceSettings.UpdateFromState to Sets all settings to a particular defined joined state.
Use RhinoCommon ChooseOneObjectSettings.RestoreDefaults to Commits the default settings as the current settings.
Use RhinoCommon ChooseOneObjectSettings.UpdateFromState to Sets all settings to a particular defined joined state.
Use RhinoCommon CommandAliasList.Clear to Removes all aliases from the list.
Use RhinoCommon CommandAliasList.GetDefaults to Constructs a dictionary containing as keys the default names and as value the default macro. The returned dictionary contains a copy of the settings.

Use RhinoCommon CommandAliasList.ToDictionary to Constructs a new dictionary that contains: as keys all names and as values all macros. Modifications to this dictionary do not affect any Rhino command alias.
Use RhinoCommon CurvatureAnalysisSettings.RestoreDefaults to Commits the default settings as the current settings.
Use RhinoCommon CurvatureAnalysisSettings.UpdateFromState to Sets all settings to a particular defined joined state.
Use RhinoCommon CurvatureGraphSettings.RestoreDefaults to Commits the default settings as the current settings.
Use RhinoCommon CurvatureGraphSettings.UpdateFromState to Sets all settings to a particular defined joined state.
Use RhinoCommon DraftAngleAnalysisSettings.RestoreDefaults to Commits the default settings as the current settings.
Use RhinoCommon DraftAngleAnalysisSettings.UpdateFromState to Sets all settings to a particular defined joined state.
Use RhinoCommon EdgeAnalysisSettings.RestoreDefaults to Commits the default settings as the current settings.
Use RhinoCommon EdgeAnalysisSettings.UpdateFromState to Sets all settings to a particular defined joined state.
Use RhinoCommon FileSettings.SetAutoSaveBeforeCommands to Set list of commands that force AutoSave prior to running.
Use RhinoCommon FileSettings.UpdateFromState to Sets all settings to a particular defined joined state.
Use RhinoCommon ModelAidSettings.UpdateFromState to Updates from a particular setting state.
Use RhinoCommon OpenGLSettings.RestoreDefaults to Updates from the default setting state.
Use RhinoCommon OpenGLSettings.UpdateFromState to Updates from a particular setting state.
Use RhinoCommon SelectionFilterSettings.RestoreDefaults to Commits the default settings as the current settings.
Use RhinoCommon SelectionFilterSettings.UpdateFromState to Sets all settings to a particular defined joined state.
Use RhinoCommon ShortcutKeySettings.SetMacro to Set a macro for a given key and modifier combination
Use RhinoCommon ShortcutKeySettings.SetMacro to Set macro associated with a keyboard shortcut
Use RhinoCommon ShortcutKeySettings.Update to Add or modify shortcuts with a list or KeyboardShortcut elements
Use RhinoCommon SmartTrackSettings.UpdateFromState to Updates from a particular setting state.
Use RhinoCommon ViewSettings.RestoreDefaults to Updates from the default setting state.
Use RhinoCommon ViewSettings.UpdateFromState to Updates from a particular setting state.
Use RhinoCommon ZebraAnalysisSettings.RestoreDefaults to Commits the default settings as the current settings.
Use RhinoCommon ZebraAnalysisSettings.UpdateFromState to Sets all settings to a particular defined joined state.
Use RhinoCommon Command.DisplayHelp to Displays help for a command.
Use RhinoCommon Command.GetCommandContextHelpUrl to Returns a command's context help url.

Use RhinoCommon Command.GetCommandStack to Determines if Rhino is currently running a command. Because Rhino allow for transparent commands (commands that can be run from inside of other commands), this method returns the total ids of active commands.
code:
import Rhino.Commands

result = Rhino.Commands.Command.GetCommandStack()
# Returns: System.Guid

instruction: Use RhinoCommon Command.LookupCommandId to Returns the ID of a command.
code:
import Rhino.Commands

result = Rhino.Commands.Command.LookupCommandId("value", True)
# Returns: System.Guid

instruction: Use RhinoCommon Command.LookupCommandName to Returns the command name given a command ID.
code:
import Rhino.Commands

result = Rhino.Commands.Command.LookupCommandName(System.Guid.Empty, True)
# Returns: str

instruction: Use RhinoCommon Command.RunProxyCommand to Execute some code as if it were running in a command
code:
import Rhino.Commands

result = Rhino.Commands.Command.RunProxyCommand(None, None, None)
# Returns: System.Void

instruction: Use RhinoCommon DisplayModeDescription.AddDisplayMode to Adds a new display mode.
Use RhinoCommon DisplayModeDescription.CopyDisplayMode to Copies an existing display mode.
Use RhinoCommon DisplayModeDescription.DeleteDiplayMode to Deletes an existing display mode.
Use RhinoCommon DisplayModeDescription.DeleteDisplayMode to Deletes an existing display mode.
Use RhinoCommon DisplayModeDescription.ImportFromFile to Imports a DisplayModeDescription from a Windows-style .ini file.
code:
import Rhino.Display

result = Rhino.Display.DisplayModeDescription.ImportFromFile("value", True)
# Returns: System.Guid

instruction: Use RhinoCommon DisplayModeDescription.ImportFromFile to Imports a DisplayModeDescription from a Windows-style .ini file.
Use RhinoCommon DisplayPipeline.AvailableOpenGLVersion to If Rhino is using OpenGL for display, this function will return major.minor version of OpenGL available for this instance of Rhino
Use RhinoCommon DisplayPipeline.GetDrawListSerialNumbers to Gets the current model and page view draw list serial numbers, which can be used to determine if a model or page view needs to be redrawn.
Use RhinoCommon RhinoViewport.FromId to Call this method to get the viewport with the specified Id.
Use RhinoCommon VisualAnalysisMode.AdjustAnalysisMeshes to Interactively adjusts surface analysis meshes of objects using a Rhino built-in analysis mode.
code:
import Rhino.Display

result = Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.AdjustAnalysisMeshes(None, System.Guid.Empty)
# Returns: bool

instruction: Use RhinoCommon VisualAnalysisMode.Find to Finds a visual analysis mode by guid.

Use RhinoCommon UserData.Copy to Expert user tool that copies user data that has a positive CopyCount from the source object to a destination object. Generally speaking you don't need to use Copy(). Simply rely on things like the copy constructors to do the right thing.
code:
import Rhino.DocObjects.Custom

result = Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Copy(None, None)
# Returns: System.Void

instruction: Use RhinoCommon UserData.MoveUserDataFrom to Moves the user data from objectWithUserData to a temporary data storage identified by the return Guid. When MoveUserDataFrom returns, the objectWithUserData will not have any user data.
Use RhinoCommon UserData.MoveUserDataTo to Moves the user data. See for more information.
code:
import Rhino.DocObjects.Custom

result = Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.MoveUserDataTo(None, System.Guid.Empty, True)
# Returns: System.Void

instruction: Create a new ObjRef object: Initializes a new object reference from a guid and component index. The component index is used to specify a "piece" of the geometry
Create a new ObjRef object: Initializes a new object reference from a globally unique identifier ( Guid ).
Create a new ObjRef object: Initializes a new object reference from a guid and component index. The component index is used to specify a "piece" of the geometry
code:
import Rhino.DocObjects

obj = Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef(None, System.Guid.Empty, None)

instruction: Create a new ObjRef object: Initializes a new object reference from a globally unique identifier ( Guid ).
Use RhinoCommon File3dm.ReadApplicationData to Reads only the application information from an existing 3dm file.
Create a new NameHash object: Creates a new NameHash, representing a piece of text.
code:
import Rhino.FileIO

obj = Rhino.FileIO.NameHash("value", System.Guid.Empty, True)

instruction: Create a new NameHash object: Creates a new NameHash, representing a piece of text.
code:
import Rhino.FileIO

obj = Rhino.FileIO.NameHash("value", System.Guid.Empty, None)

instruction: Create a new NameHash object: Creates a new NameHash, representing a piece of text.

Use RhinoCommon SHA1OpenNURBS.FileSystemPathHash to Computes the SHA1 hash of a file system path, converted to UTF8. These file system paths have identical values of FileSystemPathHash(): /x/y/z/name.ext \x\y\z\name.ext /x//y//z/name.ext /x/y/a/b/c/../../../z/name.ext /X/Y/Z/NAME.EXT (When ignore...
code:
import Rhino.FileIO

result = Rhino.FileIO.SHA1OpenNURBS.FileSystemPathHash("value", True)
# Returns: System.Byte

instruction: Use RhinoCommon SHA1OpenNURBS.StringHash to Computes the SHA1 hash of a string, converted to UTF8.
code:
import Rhino.FileIO

result = Rhino.FileIO.SHA1OpenNURBS.StringHash()
# Returns: System.Byte

instruction: Create a new Arrowhead object: Constructor
code:
import Rhino.Geometry as rg

obj = rg.Arrowhead(None, System.Guid.Empty)

instruction: Use RhinoCommon SubDDisplayParameters.AbsoluteDisplayDensityFromSubD to Gets absolute SubD display density for subd.

instruction: Use RhinoCommon LicenseUtils.CheckInLicense to Checks in a previously checked out license to the Zoo server from which it was checked out.
Use RhinoCommon LicenseUtils.CheckOutLicense to Checks out a license that is on loan from a Zoo server on a permanent basis.
Use RhinoCommon LicenseUtils.ConvertLicense to Converts a product license from a standalone node to a network node.
Use RhinoCommon PlugIn.Find to Finds the plug-in instance that was loaded from a given plug-in Id.
Use RhinoCommon PlugIn.GetEnglishCommandNames to Gets names of all "non-test" commands for a given plug-in.
Use RhinoCommon PlugIn.GetPlugInInfo to Returns detailed information about an installed Rhino plug-in.
Use RhinoCommon PlugIn.IdFromFileName to Attempt to get a plugiin id from just the filename of a plug-in
Use RhinoCommon PlugIn.IdFromName to Gets the id of an installed plug-in giving the plug-in's name.
code:
import Rhino.PlugIns

result = Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn.IdFromName("value")
# Returns: System.Guid

instruction: Use RhinoCommon PlugIn.LoadPlugIn to Loads an installed plug-in.

Use RhinoCommon PlugIn.LoadPlugIn to Attempt to load a plug-in at a path. Loaded plug-ins are remembered by Rhino between sessions, so this function can also be considered a plug-in installation routine
code:

result = Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn.LoadPlugIn("value", System.Guid.Empty)
# Returns: LoadPlugInResult

result = Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn.PlugInExists(System.Guid.Empty, True, True)
# Returns: bool

instruction: Use RhinoCommon PlugIn.RaiseOnPlugInSettingsSavedEvent to Raise any pending OnPlugInSettingsSaved events, the events are normally queued while a command is running and fired while Rhino is in an idle state. Calling this method will raise any pending changed events regardless of Rhino's current id...

code:

Use RhinoCommon CustomRenderMeshProvider.AllObjectsChanged to Call this method if your render meshes change.

# Returns: System.Void

instruction: Use RhinoCommon AssemblyResolver.AddSearchFile to Register another file with the Assembly Resolver. File must be a .NET assembly, so it should probably be a dll, rhp or exe.

Use RhinoCommon AssemblyResolver.AddSearchFolder to Register a custom folder with the Assembly Resolver. Folders will be searched recursively, so this could potentially be a very expensive operation. If at all possible, you should consider only registering individual files.
Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.ClearFpuExceptionStatus to Clear FPU exception and busy flags (Intel assembly fnclex)
Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.CreateCommands to Parses a plugin and create all the commands defined therein.
Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.DebugString to Prints a debug message to the Rhino Command Line. The message will only appear if the SendDebugToCommandLine property is set to true.
Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.DebugString to Prints a debug message to the Rhino Command Line. The message will only appear if the SendDebugToCommandLine property is set to true.
Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.DisplayOleAlerts to Defines if Ole alerts ("Server busy") alerts should be visualized. This function makes no sense on Mono.
Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.ExceptionReport to Informs RhinoCommon of an exception that has been handled but that the developer wants to screen.
Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.ExceptionReport to Informs RhinoCommon of an exception that has been handled but that the developer wants to screen.
code:
import Rhino.Runtime

result = Rhino.Runtime.HostUtils.ExceptionReport("value", None)

instruction: Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.GetActivePlugInVersionFolders to Recurses through the auto install plug-in folders and returns the directories containing "active" versions of plug-ins.

Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.GetCurrentProcessInfo to Returns information about the current process. If Rhino is the top level process, processName is "Rhino". Otherwise, processName is the name, without extension, of the main module that is executing. For example, "compute.backend" or "Revit". proc...
Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.GetRhinoDotNetAssembly to Only works on Windows. Returns None on Mac.

Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.InitializeRhinoCommon_RDK to Makes sure all static RhinoCommon RDK components are set up correctly. This happens automatically when the RDK is loaded, so you probably won't have to call this method.

Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.InitializeRhinoCommon to Makes sure all static RhinoCommon components is set up correctly. This happens automatically when a plug-in is loaded, so you probably won't have to call this method.

Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.InitializeZooClient to Initializes the ZooClient and Rhino license manager, this should get called automatically when RhinoCommon is loaded so you probably won't have to call this method.

Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.InPlaceConstCast to DO NOT USE UNLESS YOU ARE CERTAIN ABOUT THE IMPLICATIONS. This is an expert user function which should not be needed in most cases. This function is similar to a const_cast in C++ to allow an object to be made temporarily modifiable without causing Rh...
code:
import Rhino.Runtime

result = Rhino.Runtime.HostUtils.InPlaceConstCast(None, True)
# Returns: System.Void

instruction: Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.LoadAssemblyFrom to Calls Assembly.LoadFrom in .NET 4.8. May call a different routine under .NET Core

Use RhinoCommon HostUtils.LogDebugEvent to Logs a debug event. The function will log the filename and line number from where this function is called, in addition to the input message.

Use RhinoCommon Interop.FileReadOptionsConstPointer to Returns the underlying const CRhinoFileReadOptions* for a Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions object. You should only be interested in using this function if you are writing C++ code.

Use RhinoCommon RhinoAccountsManager.ExecuteProtectedCodeAsync to Any asynchronous method in the IRhinoAccountsManager class must be executed within the function passed to this method, or an InvalidOperationException will be thrown.
